This can be written as a private static final variable since there is only one test data file to execute.

Admittedly, we should improve the message here somewhat, especially as I don't think that response should be returned from a delete() operation. So what happens in delete() is first we get() the result. In get(), if the result is retired or voided already, we throw an exception. This is to ensure that an attempt to get() a record after it's been delete generates an error correctly.
The short version is that you're essentially asking to delete an already-voided Person record, so maybe try testing the functionality with a different Person. Nonetheless, that's a valuable error to have brought out.

@gitcliff i don't think that is the case. A 410 error means that the resource you are trying to delete is GONE. I think it might have been voided somewhere. We need to check where the bug is.
